headline: Hasbro CEO talks Netflix partnership for KPop Demon Hunters toys
summary: Toy giant Hasbro (HAS) holds a global toy license with competitor Mattel (MAT) in a partnership with Netflix (NFLX) to exclusively develop toys from the hit animated movie KPop Demon Hunters. Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks sits down with Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to talk more about the excitement behind landing the brand deal and Hasbro's plans. Be sure to catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks. Also read up on the earnings breakdown from Netflix's latest release. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Hasbro CEO talks Netflix partnership for KPop Demon Hunters toys
content.description:
Toy giant Hasbro (HAS) holds a global toy license with competitor Mattel (MAT) in a partnership with Netflix (NFLX) to exclusively develop toys from the hit animated movie KPop Demon Hunters.

Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks sits down with Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to talk more about the excitement behind landing the brand deal and Hasbro's plans.

Be sure to catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks. Also read up on the earnings breakdown from Netflix's latest release.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Hasbro Lifts Outlook as Holiday Orders Accelerate
summary: The company now expects revenue to grow in the high-single digits, compared with a prior outlook of mid-single digit growth, amid a pickup in orders from retailers.

content.title: Hasbro Lifts Outlook as Holiday Orders Accelerate
content.summary: The company now expects revenue to grow in the high-single digits, compared with a prior outlook of mid-single digit growth, amid a pickup in orders from retailers.

headline: Hasbro Q3 Earnings and Revenues Top Estimates, EBITDA View Raised

headline: Hasbro tops Q3 estimates, CEO talks cheery outlook on toy sales
summary: Toy giant Hasbro (HAS) topped third quarter estimates with adjusted earnings per share of $1.68 (vs. estimates of $1.63) and revenue of $1.39 billion (vs. estimates of $1.34 billion). Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks sits down with Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to discuss the buying power he is still seeing from American consumers across its product lines, the company's forecast ahead of the holiday shopping season, its ability to navigate tariffs, and its collaboration with major companies on toy lines such as Disney (DIS) and Netflix's (NFLX) KPop Demon Hunters. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) Exceeds Q3 Expectations
summary: Toy and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) reported Q3 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 8.3% year on year to $1.39 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.68 per share was 2.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) Exceeds Q3 Expectations
content.summary: Toy and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) reported Q3 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 8.3% year on year to $1.39 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.68 per share was 2.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Hasbro: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: PAWTUCKET, R.I. (AP) — Hasbro Inc. HAS) on Thursday reported third-quarter net income of $233.2 million. The Pawtucket, Rhode Island-based company said it had net income of $1.64 per share.

content.title: Hasbro: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: PAWTUCKET, R.I. (AP) — Hasbro Inc. HAS) on Thursday reported third-quarter net income of $233.2 million. The Pawtucket, Rhode Island-based company said it had net income of $1.64 per share.
